selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.unconditional
Class Sigmoid

java.lang.Object
  selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.AbstractConditionalDistribution
      selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.unconditional.AbstractUnconditionalDistribution
          selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.unconditional.Sigmoid
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConditionalDistribution, UnconditionalDistribution
public class Sigmoid
extends AbstractUnconditionalDistribution

Handles a multi-state discrete representation through the use of a sigmoid

Author:
Charles Robertson

Constructor Summary
Sigmoid()
           
Sigmoid(cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix1D lvalues)
          Makes the multinomial distri bution with a set of lvalues, each vector entry can be a different size, this size corresponds to the number of states in that dimension and the stateLayout will be set accordingly.

          Makes a uniform multinomial distribution

          Makes a multinomial distribution

Sigmoid

public Sigmoid(int[] stateLayout,
               boolean random)
Makes a multinomial distribution

Parameters:
stateLayout -
random - if set, it picks lvalues from 1 to 10 uniformly at random, otherwise all lvalues are set to 1

setDistribution

public void setDistribution(int[] stateLayout,
                            boolean random)
Sets the parameters for the multinomial distribution

Parameters:
stateLayout -
random - if set it will pick lvalues from 1 to 10 uniformly at random, otherwise all lvalues are set to 1

This grabs a matrix that specifies the sufficient variables that need to be set in order to specify the distribution completely. We should be able to use this to describe the distribution in an xml file, or as a part of the front end.

marginalize

public ConditionalDistribution marginalize(int index,
                                           boolean onDependencies)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalDistribution
Marginalizes out one dimension. If index is < numDiscreteDimensions, it marginalizes out that discrete dimension at index, otherwise it marginalizes out numContinuousDimensions - index dimension in the continuous domain.

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

extend

public int extend(int numStates)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConditionalDistribution
This extends the distribution by 1 dimension. If numStates <= 0, then it extends it in a continuous direction, otherwise it extends it in the discrete domain by adding a dimension with numStates states

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem extending the distribution
